meanings.definition: Comparative form of gimp: having a limp or other physical disability
meanings.sent1: After his injury, he walked gimpier than before.
meanings.sent2: The injured dog moved gimpier than the others in the park.
meanings.sent3: The gimpier walk made him the slowest in the race.
meanings.sent4: Her gimpier steps echoed through the quiet hallway.
meanings.sent5: The gimpier leg struggled to keep up with the rest of his body.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of gimp: awkward or clumsy
meanings.sent1: Carrying the heavy box made him feel gimpier than usual.
meanings.sent2: She felt gimpier than her friends when trying to dance.
meanings.sent3: His gimpier movements on the dance floor drew laughter from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The gimpier attempts at juggling resulted in dropped balls everywhere.
meanings.sent5: Her gimpier coordination caused her to bump into furniture often.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of gimp: inferior in quality or performance
meanings.sent1: The gimpier product did not last as long as the others.
meanings.sent2: His gimpier painting did not receive as much praise as his previous work.
meanings.sent3: The gimpier car struggled to reach the top speed on the highway.
meanings.sent4: The gimpier phone model had constant technical issues.
meanings.sent5: Her gimpier singing voice did not impress the judges as much.
